TermDefinition.DefinitionText: Cancer that develops in C cells of the thyroid. The C cells make a hormone (calcitonin) that helps maintain a healthy level of calcium in the blood.

MediaLink.alt: Pronunciation of dictionary term "medullary thyroid cancer"
Pronunciation of dictionary term "cáncer de tiroides medular"

SpanishTermDefinition.DefinitionText: Cáncer que se desarrolla en las células C de la tiroidea. Las células C elaboran una hormona (calcitonina) que ayuda a mantener una concentración saludable de calcio en la sangre.

RelatedInformation.RelatedSummaryRef: Genetics of Endocrine and Neuroendocrine Neoplasias
